Enables a timer when choosing the participating mode of the battles (for the single player sessions)
Enables a timer when choosing the participating mode of the battles (for the multiplayer sessions)
Enables the manual mode for the battles.

By researching increasingly complex scientific advances and developing increasingly sophisticated technology, you can arrive at a point where all other empires will be forced to acknowledge your mastery. Victory will be assured by the construction of the most advanced Applied Sciences technology.

Through trade and development, you can enrich your empire to the point that all other peoples have no choice but to bow before the enormous power brought by your unimaginable wealth. Once you have generated enough Dust during the development in your empire, victory is yours!
By conquering and colonizing a maximum of planets and systems, your empire can become all-powerful through sheer weight of numbers. Once you control 75% of all systems, the galaxy is yours.

With armadas of powerful vessels and an unbending will, through domination of the stars you can force both friends and enemies to accept you as the uncontested ruler. You will win this victory when you have invaded the starting systems of all other factions.

By gaining a level of mastery in the many complex elements of an empire - economy, military, science, etc. - you can create a civilization that is second to none. This victory will be determined by the faction with the highest score after a fixed number of turns.

You can achieve the respect and fealty of all other empires by building creations so great that all people will hail you as a legendary paragon of civilization. This will occur when you build the Wonder Victory building a certain number of times.

By building alliances and friendships with other factions and empires, you become highly valuable as a friend and simply too dangerous as an enemy. When you have accumulated enough Diplomatic Victory points in the great game of galactic diplomacy, you become the dominant political force in the galaxy.

You have retreated from the conflict, leaving victory to another empire.
While retreat is sometimes preferable to ignoble death, there is a fine line between 'advancing to the rear' and merely running away, terrified. Your chances of re-election are, quite frankly, grim.
The conflict has run its course; fate and Dust have determined a victor.
This is the breakdown of faction ranking by category
Another faction has reached its objective before you.
Life's lessons are occasionally painful. But today's defeat is little more than a test of your resolve; it is only a matter of time before you emerge victorious.
You no longer have any planets in your possession.

Your empire has been decimated. Lacking any planets, you have been reduced to a rag-tag fugitive fleet of vagrants with little hope for the future. Your dreams have turned into the most prosaic of dusts…
You no longer have any planets in your possession.

Your empire has been decimated. Lacking any planets, you have been reduced to a rag-tag fugitive fleet of vagrants with little hope for the future. Your dreams have turned into the most prosaic of dusts…

Little remains unknown concerning the role, history, and future of the universe. In many ways your technology is equivalent to that of the Endless, and your unquestioned mastery of Dust has driven all other peoples to acknowledge your supremacy.

What is this? Through the study of advanced sciences, another faction has developed to the point that they are the uncontested masters of this galaxy. Let us hope they treat lesser beings like you with benevolence, and not contempt.

Harnessing the economic power of myriad systems and controlling vast reservoirs of Dust, the galaxy is a great spider's web with you at the center. What you do not own you can buy, and what you cannot buy you have the power to destroy. Friends and enemies alike bow their heads in awe.
It is too late for you. Another faction has collected Dust to the point where they have an unassailable base of economic power. With luck, you will be able to find a role as a favored servant.
You have conquered $ExpansionVictoryPercentageOfGalaxyColonized% of the galaxy's systems.

You gaze up at the stars in the sky, and realize that many of them belong to you. From a desperate start on a sole planet, your people have spread to become a vast empire of uncountable citizens. Controlling Dust by the sheer number of planets under your sway, the other nations of this galaxy have no choice but to acknowledge your rule.
$ExpansionVictoryPercentageOfGalaxyColonized% of the galaxy's systems have been conquered by another faction.

Whether you have struggled hard and achieved your goals is now a moot point. Another empire controls so many of the galaxy's systems that you have no choice but to acknowledge their supremacy and surrender before their legions. Let us hope they do not place their boots on your neck as you bow before them.
Your empire has conquered the homeworlds of all known factions in the galaxy.

The night sky contains hundreds of planets and billions of asses, and you have kicked them all. With vast fleets and armies at your command, your will has become reality and you have made your word the only law. The secrets of the Endless will soon be yours, and Dust is but one of the many resources under your control.
Another empire has conquered the homeworlds of all the known factions in the galaxy.

There are many paths to domination, but the one you chose is apparently a dead end. Another empire has conquered the homeworlds of all the known factions in the galaxy, and now rules supreme through puppet governments. With luck they will exploit you as a useful tool, rather than stamp you out.
At the end of turn $ScoreVictoryGameTurn, your empire has the highest score and has been declared winner.

It is not a simple thing to be a fair and balanced ruler. The needs of the people, the economy, and military must be weighed against science and exploration. But you have done it; this galaxy is but a great sandbox in which you and your people hold sway. You control the supplies of Dust as well, and with it the keys to the secrets of the Endless.
At the end of turn $ScoreVictoryGameTurn, the faction with the highest score has been declared winner.

It is awesome, is it not? An empire has achieved such progress across all fronts that it has risen to a place of unquestionable control and domination. Sadly, that empire is not yours, and you must accept them as your masters.
Glory! Your empire has built the $WonderVictoryConstructibleName $WonderVictoryWonderVictoryScore times.

Not since the time of the Endless has the galaxy seen such wonders. The cost in time, sweat, and Dust has been great, and the sacrifices made are too numerous to count. But with your will you have created monuments whose fame will echo through history, and your name shall echo with it.
Horror! Another faction has built $WonderVictoryWonderVictoryScore times the $WonderVictoryConstructibleName.

You have just seen the news. In spite of your best efforts, another empire has built structures of such magnificence that all and sundry stand amazed by their genius. The true children of the Endless, the glory of their creations amazes even your own people. You have lost, and will soon be reduced to a seldom-clicked link in the hypertexts of history.
Your empire has accumulated $DiplomaticVictoryDiplomaticVictoryProgress points on the great scales of galactic diplomacy.

Though the diverse peoples of the galaxy do not necessarily stand united in brotherly love, you have at least created a stable, peaceful environment where trade and science advance to the benefit of all. By extending a firm but friendly grip across such a wide scope, you can obtain Dust and the secrets of the Endless from your allies.
Another empire has accumulated $DiplomaticVictoryDiplomaticVictoryProgress points on the great scales of galactic diplomacy.

It is of no use. Regardless of whatever military or economic might you possess or what industrial or scientific wonders you have created, another faction has out-maneuvered you. They have created a web of alliances of such strength that your empire, in comparison, is reduced to nothing.

A faction of highly organized corporations, the United Empire's strengths are economic and military.

Home Planet Type: Terran Diplomatic Alignment: Evil Gameplay: Colonialist Main Victory Type: Economic/Military
The Empire is theoretically under the control of a central monarchy. However, the rate of expansion means that the society cannot be ruled that way effectively. In fact, the systems of the colonial diaspora are colonized by designated Corporations who work hand-in-hand with the Ministry of Investment and Development. The Ministry of Security is involved as well, due to the need for native and/or alien pacification, security forces, defense, and surveillance.
Eerie creatures from a swampy planet, these diplomats have an uncanny ability to understand their opponents.

Home Planet Type: Ocean Diplomatic Alignment: Good Gameplay: Exploration, Diplomacy Main Victory Type: Diplomatic/Military
A highly evolved form of a lowly species, these colorful beings come from an ocean world. Evolving slowly over millions of years with plenty of time to philosophize, it is not surprising that the Amoeba are diplomatic, cultural, and intellectual. Wise and urbane, they have an exceptionally high 'emotional intelligence' and are unusually open to other alien and intelligent species. Their goal is to travel, meet, and learn, though their relatively defenseless natural form has bred into them the need to turn all situations to their advantage, and to be in control of their destiny. Though the Amoeba do not feel that their nature is to dominate and conquer, they can be viewed as warriors whose weapons are diplomacy and trade.
They are the Cravers. Everything else is their food.

Home Planet Type: Arid Diplomatic Alignment: Evil Gameplay: Consume Worlds Main Victory Type: Military
Created by the Endless from an insectoid life form, the Cravers are in the purest sense hunter-gatherers and would never have evolved on their own the processes necessary to raise crops or domesticate animals. Their life cycle is based on consumption, and as such they are capable of digesting any form of plant or animal matter. Once their home world was consumed, they left to seek further nourishment. If they do not continue to expand, discover, and exploit new worlds, their society could literally eat itself to death. Feeding the hive is their all-consuming purpose; the notions of 'treaty', 'trade', and 'peace' do not exist.
Adept at science and fond of discussion and debate, the Sophons seek knowledge and understanding.

Home Planet Type: Terran Diplomatic Alignment: Good Gameplay: Amazing Scientists Main Victory Type: Scientific
Curious, analytical, and inquisitive, the Sophons are a people who value knowledge over all. No theory -- or machine -- is so perfect that it can resist a bit of tinkering; advances come both in great leaps and tiny increments. The Sophons travel the galaxy driven by a thirst to discover and understand; they therefore view war as nothing more than a distraction from the serious things in life. However, given their advanced technologies, they can become a surprisingly dangerous foe.
Curious, adaptable, and restless, this faction seeks the home planet of the legendary Endless.

Home Planet Type: Jungle Diplomatic Alignment: Good Gameplay: Exploration, Diplomacy Main Victory Type: Diplomatic/Military
A group of scientists and explorers, unhappy with the United Empire, hijacked a mission to an outer planet and set up an independent government. They refused the heavy corporate hand of the Empire, preferring to eke out their living on the edge of known space. Aided by the Sophons, this splinter group grew to become the Pilgrims. Accustomed to orbital living and constant movement, during the early years of their development they had a proportionally greater contact and familiarity with artifacts and remnants left by the Endless. They have come to view the Endless in a religious light, and a goal of their society is to one day discover the planet from which the Endless originated.
Proud warriors and aviators, the Hissho are primarily interested in the search for honor and glory.

Home Planet Type: Jungle Diplomatic Alignment: Evil Gameplay: Conquest, Glory Main Victory Type: Military/Population
The Hissho are a modern and civilized peoples descended from avian DNA. However, they are avian in the way that many species of dinosaur had avian characteristics; in fact, they are not unlike feathered pterodactyls. A race of highly competitive tribal warriors, their history is one of bloodshed, conquest, vengeance, and domination. While this has created a very hardy, aggressive, and dangerous people, it has also slowed their advancement and limited their numbers. When they did reach the stars to find other peoples waiting for them, their reaction was to conquer and dominate. Their innate and learned sense of flight makes them superlative pilots.
Horatio, founder of the Horatio, would beautify the universe by filling it with beings that look like… Horatio.

Home Planet Type: Arid Diplomatic Alignment: Neutral Gameplay: Expand Main Victory Type: Population/Wonder
Incredibly wealthy and only slightly less deranged, Horatio was an Empire trillionaire who left to discover his own star cluster. Finding a planet sprinkled with labs of ancient cloning technology left by the Endless, the boredom soon drove Horatio to create a race of allies, servants, and slaves who were every bit as gorgeous as the most beautiful person in the universe -- Horatio. Once the planet was repopulated, Horatio the First had only to look up, regard the stars, and realize how much more beautiful they, too, would be if they were filled with... Horatios. The rest, as they say, is history.
Robot builders, the Sowers are on a religious mission to prepare for the return of the long-lost Endless.

Home Planet Type: Tundra Diplomatic Alignment: Neutral Gameplay: Construction Main Victory Type: Wonder/Military
The Sowers are a machine race created by the Virtual faction of the Endless. They took from their creators the mission to traverse the universe and make worlds livable and habitable for the arrival – or return – of the Endless. The Sowers come, establish industries, create the basic infrastructure needed to make a wild planet habitable, and move on to the next one. The Sowers are neither hostile nor friendly; they are simply continuing their programming. Any world they arrive on will be harvested and advanced materials will be developed. Any local populations or other peoples will be ignored -- unless they get in the way or oppose the Sowers' holy mission.
A loose federation of criminal family clans, the ABC is a constant threat to commerce.

Home Planet Type: Various Diplomatic Alignment: Evil Gameplay: Annoying Main Victory Type: Military
The universe is full of wealth and riches, and there are those who would rather take what has already been created than do the hard work themselves. While military expeditions generally destroy these bands of pirates or raiders before they become too powerful, one syndicate of pirate-traders, known as ABC (the Autonomous Bastards' Collective), has grown sufficiently large and wealthy to constitute a serious threat to galactic development.
A loyal elite faction within the Imperial Navy, the Sheredyn fleet has the right to display its traditional colors.

Home Planet Type: Terran Diplomatic Alignment: Evil Gameplay: Colonialist Main Victory Type: Economic/Military
It would require several centuries of time travel to find the origins of the military organization now known as the Sheredyn Fleet. Originally a bodyguard at the time of the first emperors, over time the Fleet grew to become commandos, special forces operatives, and finally a powerful clandestine force within the military of the United Empire. Almost a caste within the Imperial Navy, admission to the service of the Sheredyn Fleet remains impossible to all but the most qualified candidates. In a society where money means everything, the Fleet retains its image of professionalism. With several lucrative contracts from appreciative emperors, it has grown to have an economic power almost equal to its military reputation.
A pacifist race of clockwork beings living on orbital platforms, the Automatons tend worlds as if they were gardens.

Home Planet Type: Jungle Diplomatic Alignment: Good Gameplay: Peaceful and Isolationist Main Victory Type: Economic/Diplomatic
“Iron and Steel, Blood and Flesh”
The Automatons were created by a long dead civilization known as the Reyans, who perished many millennia ago due to uncontrolled industrialization and that caused irreversible damage to the ecosystem and atmosphere of their planet. The Reyans decided to leave a legacy in the form of one of their greatest technological achievements: Highly sophisticated clockwork beings. Within a year of the creation of the clockwork men, the Reyans committed mass suicide so as not to suffer through the effects of a dying planet. They left the Automatons, their greatest creations, alone and lost on the planet.
The clockwork creations of the Reyans developed a simple society of their own, until one day a large Endless ship crashed into the planet and spread Dust across its surface. The Dust modified the machines, enhancing their abilities and over time even giving them sentience. In only a few weeks the clockwork machines had evolved, gaining a new purpose in their existence. They came to call themselves the Automatons, and with the newly gained freedom of Dust they began learning…and advancing.
The Automaton civilization remained on their planet, learning to live in a symbiotic relationship with nature as the planet healed. They used the knowledge of their creators and their new Dust engines to produce massive floating ships on which they lived, thus protecting the recovering ecosystem on the planet. Over the course of centuries the planet healed and the Automatons learned to live with and love nature while developing advanced industrial capacity and production within the hulls of their floating ships -- which had also grown over time. Calculating that their Dust supply would run out and their civilization would die, the Automatons excavated the ruins of the Endless ship and began developing their own vehicles for space flight…

Good is used for lack of a better term; in fact, this means that the faction will rarely start a war without provocation and generally prefers diplomacy. These factions will dislike and mistrust a people with a powerful military, and respect nations that seek peaceful solutions.
Neutral factions do not seek military outcomes to every encounter, but balance war with diplomacy.

Evil is a simplification; these factions merely prefer the simplicity of war and control to the complex subtleties of diplomacy. They will have more respect for a powerful enemy than for a weak or diplomatic one.

Though difficult to apply outside a laboratory context, first steps are made in isolating objects from the effects of quantum and gravitational forces.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

Previously thought a practical impossibility, recent advances in shielding technology permit more than two bodies to be involved in a fusion reaction. This opens up the door to enormous leaps in energy generation.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

The construction of a high-energy particle accelerator (with energy measured in peta-electron volts) requires highly advanced engineering, science, materials, and energy supplies. Without this type of machine, explorations deeper into sub-quantum mechanics would not be possible.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

One problem with coordinating robots and having them efficiently function is their 'brains' and the associated networking. Advances in signal technology and computing algorithms now allow us to have vast numbers of robots that communicate and execute functions in seamless coordination.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
This technology permits the extraction of ores from places within planetary cores where gravitational forces would normally destroy both beings and equipment.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
The ability to permanently apply grafted or genetically engineered traits into the DNA of succulent plants has great, long-term advantages for simplifying colonization.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

A critical pre-requisite to colonizing another planet is to have a firm idea of the science, processes, and skills necessary to do it in a sustainable manner. Recycling, renewable energy sources, pollution control, and careful consumption are among the requirements.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
While great leaps forward in fusion technology are on the horizon, the ability to miniaturize and simplify existing fusion technology also provides practical rewards.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
Discovery of alien life forms and analysis of plants that survive in extreme environments come together in a new field that has practical applications for colonization.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
Studies of soil samples from other planets plus advances in understanding of extremophilic bacteria permit scientists to create, under certain conditions, hardier and more productive crops.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

First contacts with alien beings cause a rapid development in disparate branches of study - linguistics, anthropology, biology, sociology. These are quickly brought together under the unifying title of "Xenology."
Unlocks the technology of the same name

Early advances in systems that capture signatures from particles--be they matter or anti-matter--permit simple 'scanners' that poll space-time for any activity--even neutrino, photon and graviton. This information is used to find, identify, and track all objects that will enter or exit a planetary system.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

The effect of time dilation and space travel on traditional financial models is non-negligible. This new branch of economics provides a basis for defining investment and profit under non-Newtonian physics in non-Euclidean space-time, e.g. observed interest rates, human capital erosion, and NPV (Net Proto-Heisenberg Value).
Unlocks the technology of the same name
High-isotope materials are prized for both their material capacities and their energy content. Manufacturing them in large quantities is key to making them economically viable.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

Once heavier high-technology materials can be mass produced, the next critical step is to be able to shape and adapt them as desired. This requires advanced robotics, computing, and a great deal of energy.
Unlocks the technology of the same name

A side benefit of the space program, highly advanced fabrics and ceramics are developed that also have practical usage for armor. Layered, compressed, or reactive, they make buildings and vehicles highly resistant.
Unlocks the technology of the same name
The trait points balance of the selected faction
A first fleet, constituted of a scout and a colonization ship
Generates a positive Anomaly on the home planet
Generates a negative Anomaly on the home planet
Due to its formation from dust clouds that spun off from the system's sun, the crust of this planet is unusually rich in minerals.
Basically a big ball of silica and dirt, the planet's crust is abnormally poor in metals and minerals. Both life and industry struggle to adapt in this situation.
The soil of this planet is rich in bacteria and nutrients; crops will grow well and livestock will be healthy.

Though not lacking in dirt, the planet is surprisingly low in the nutrients and microbes that turn it into a rich compound that stimulates organic life. As a result, agricultural prospects are worse than usual.
Once a base or battleground of the Endless civilization, their nanotechnological 'Dust' is omnipresent in the ground and atmosphere.

Rich in deposits of copper, iron, zinc, and other metals, the lakes and geysers of this planet are stunning to behold. The high metal content of the waters is also a boon to industrial development, as highly purified ores can be obtained through simple filtration.

A rich, multi-colored band of asteroids surrounds this planet. Reflecting the star's light in green, gray, purple, white, and blue, they are a highly prized tourist destination as well as a ready source of minerals and alloys.

An unfortunate side effect of Tan-Erbo's horticultural tampering, these large, carnivorous, orange plants will aggressively defend their territory. While they are potentially dangerous, they also have delicious fruit that can be used to make a wide variety of excellent candies. There are two risks when colonizing this planet, then; aggressive foliage and tooth decay.
The sum of all of positive trait points for the selected faction
The sum of all of negative trait points for the selected faction

Auto Upgrade Ship Design in Queue
When this option is selected and each time you modify a ship design, all ships using this ship design and placed in a construction queue will be automatically upgraded.

Synchronizes the game rendering with your monitor refresh rate. 0 = no Vsync. 1 = synchronized to the monitor refresh rate. 2 = synchronized every 2 frames of refresh, so at half the refresh rate of your monitor.
Move this slider to set the target frame rate.
Move this slider to set the ambiance volume.
Move this slider to set the master volume.
Move this slider to set the music volume.
Move this slider to set the GUI sound FX volume.
Move this slider to set the sound FX volume.

A young star that is weak and cold; little more than a dense molecular cloud. Colder, drier planets are common; easily colonizable planets are rare. There is a slightly better chance of finding gas giants.
Among the hottest and brightest of all stars. Warmer, drier planets are common; easily colonizable planets are less common.
A star with heavy hydrogen content. There may be some easily colonizable planets, but a better probability of planets that are slightly more difficult to colonize. Gas giants are very rare.
A star whose heat is average -- for a blazing ball of nuclear fusion. There is a high probability of finding planets that require minimal research to colonize. Gas giants are very rare.
A relatively small and cool star that is long-lived. Easily colonizable planets are very rare; less hospitable planets are common. There is a greater chance of gas giants.
A very large star in terms of volume, though not mass, and relatively cool. It is unlikely to have either easily colonized planets or gas giants.
A very small, very old, very dense, and very weak star near the end of its life. The less easily colonized rocky planets are more common here, and gas giants may be found.
A system of two stars orbiting around their common barycenter. Dry, hot, and rocky planets are more common, and rarely gas giants.
A diameter of a few hundred kilometers
A diameter of a few thousand kilometers
A diameter measured in the tens of thousands of kilometers
A mix of land and water geology, this planet type is easy to exploit.
Primarily or entirely covered by water, this planet type is rich in life and resources.
Dense with vegetation, this planet type can support a large population.
Though partially covered in ice and snow, this planet is still relatively easy to exploit.
Relatively dry, this planet type is still valuable for farming and development.
Glacial and snow-covered, exploitation of this planet requires some effort.
With its waterless surface, this planet is more difficult to colonize and exploit.
Tectonically active and hot, advanced science is necessary to colonize this planet
Lacking both water and atmosphere, exploitation of this planet type is very difficult.
One of the large gas giants, it is the most difficult planet type to settle and develop.
One of the large gas giants, it is the most difficult planet type to settle and develop.
One of the large gas giants, it is the most difficult planet type to settle and develop.
Essentially a bunch of rocks in a vacuum, colonization of asteroids requires very advanced science.
Uninhabited and lacking any notable anomaly (either positive or negative), this planetary body presents no unusual characteristics. Note: This can be a very good thing.

Lush and pleasant, with a single year-round season of pleasantly moderate temperatures, life is good on this planet. Everyone benefits from its natural wealth: Residents, tourists, businessmen, and scientists.

Search teams discover ruins of one of the many ancient civilizations that have risen and fallen since the birth of the universe. Trade, tourism, and research could potentially benefit from this rare find.

Away teams, wearing red shirts to be easily found in the event of death, discovered numerous OOPArts -- Out Of Place Artifacts. Their origin and the identity of their makers is not known, but they will certainly be of value to researchers and of interest to tourists.

Many ruins from the time of the Endless were Dust-enhanced structures or traditional buildings that preceded the Dust era. On very rare occasions, however, one can find entire structures built uniquely from this valuable resource.

Picturesque, rich, and fascinating, these lush reefs beautify the planet, provide sources of food, and are of interest to tourists (once they have been declared either non-lethal or only partially lethal).

A hybrid species that grew from Dust-infected lichen, this nearly indestructible plant can be found thriving even in the harshest conditions. Its beautiful, glossy sheen and interesting bio-technical properties create both a stunning environment and a source of scientific knowledge.

Native inhabitants can be classified in one of two ways: those who view you as friends, and those who view you as dinner. Fortunately, this is the former case. By accelerating the colonists' adaptaton to the local ecosystem, they permit a higher density of population than is common on a planet of this size.

What strange beasts were these! Science Officers have discovered the remains of long-dead creatures that appear exceptional in every way -- size, variety, eating habits, and number of limbs. Anthropologists and cosmologists are eager to study these finds.
The soil of this planet is rich in bacteria and nutrients; crops will grow well and livestock will be healthy.
Due to its formation from dust clouds that spun off from the system's sun, the crust of this planet is unusually rich in minerals.
Once a base or battleground of the Endless civilization, their nanotechnological 'Dust' is omnipresent in the ground and atmosphere.

Having deep oceans that are rich with life, this planet is abundant in hadopelagic creatures -- those that have adapted to the lightless environment at the bottom of the ocean and are tolerant of the tremendous pressures. They are not only a source of food, but provide useful scientific information on extremophilic life forms.

Another innovation of the Endless, some Visited planets were sown with these Dust-built millimeter-scale factories that convert mineral solids into nutrient chains for crops. Adaptable or 'trainable' to a wide range of ecosystems, they are an enormous boon to food production and agricultural labor.
Dense rings of beige and brown asteroids with erratic orbits, the planetary rings are fascinating for tourists and equally interesting for scientific studies.

A rich, multi-colored band of asteroids surrounds this planet. Reflecting the star's light in green, gray, purple, white, and blue, they are a highly prized tourist destination as well as a ready source of minerals and alloys.

About as anomalous as an anomaly can be, this planet has vast subterranean spaces that run hundreds of kilometers. Fascinating to tourists and scientists, it adds a great deal of habitable space that is highly defensible.

An example of biodiversity gone berserk, this planet shows a variety of plant mutations of every size, shape, color, scent, flavor, and psychoactive effect that one could imagine. Some of the more notable results include rich food supplies and ecstatic gourmet chefs.
A lower density of planetary core effects many things, of which gravity is the most notable. This has advantages for industrial production and makes kids really, really happy.

An eerie reminder of yet another lost civilization, deserted cities are scattered across the surface of this planet. Even stranger, many of the buildings and machines are still in working order. If a planet had been conceived to make scientists and engineers happy, it is this one.

Blessed--or cursed--by volcanic activity close to the surface and a metal-rich crust, geysers of molten metal spew their very dangerous and very valuable contents from numerous points on the planet. Industry and commerce can clearly benefit from this bizarre geology.
Rich in oxygen and other useful gases, the atmosphere of this planet is its main advantage. Food will be readily available, and native populations will be healthy and happy.

A rare form of ice that is caused by water crystallizing under high pressures, Ice 10 is interesting for its thermodynamic properties. Its extremely low temperatures, however, mean that the planet has a dangerous and hostile environment.

A rare form of ice that is caused by water crystallizing under high pressures, Ice 10 is interesting for its thermodynamic properties. A concerted effort by the planet's engineers has led to a lessening of its negative effects.

The surface of this planet is a riot of cliffs, chasms, ridges, and spikes. While the broken surface means that many mineral resources can be easily mined, it also means that transport and construction will be challenging..

The surface of this planet is a riot of cliffs, chasms, ridges, and spikes. While the broken surface once meant that exploitation was difficult, a concerted effort by the planet's inhabitants has made this less problematic.
Dude, where's my silica? These volcanoes of ultramafic rock from deep within the planet's mantle are sources of useful metal alloys, and can be cheaply exploited for geothermal energy.
This is not merely a planet that has the benefit of an axial tilt that produces seasonal variations in weather; the seasons and their associated climates lend themselves well to agriculture.

The good news: This is a water-rich planet and therefore of great value to agriculture. The bad news: This water is generally delivered horizontally in your face by gale-force winds. Tides and winds, fortunately, also provide ready sources of (wet) energy.
Once a very wet and very difficult environment, a concerted effort to partially terraform the planet has lessened the intensity of the winds and storms.

Not all planets have a molten core, which provides some distinct advantages such as a natural magnetic field that shields the planet from cosmic rays and plate tectonics which contribute to evolution. For both these reasons, scientists find this type of planet particularly interesting.

Rich in deposits of copper, iron, zinc, and other metals, the lakes and geysers of this planet are stunning to behold. The high metal content of the waters is also a boon to industrial development, as highly purified ores can be obtained through simple filtration.

Whatever civilization once thrived on this planet, all that remains are the rubble of buildings and a strangely helpful and obedient population of robots. Anthropologists may one day determine how and why they were created, but for now their main value is as a dedicated and uncomplaining workforce.

Gleaming, multi-colored auroras last all day and night, moving eerily across the surface of the planet. Though their properties are greatly appreciated by residents and tourists, the electromagnetic residue is a headache for scientists.

The gleaming, multi-colored auroras that once caused such headaches have been partially tamed by magnetic shielding. Fortunately, their beauty remains even though their negative effects have been reduced.
Almost dirt-free, the hard, gleaming surface of this planet makes agriculture difficult and potentially poisonous. The ease with which rare metals can be recovered, however, is a great advantage.
Almost dirt-free, the hard, gleaming surface of this planet used to make agriculture difficult and potentially poisonous. Recent improvements in soil development, however, have eased the problem.

Lava planets in particular, due to the continual combustion and high temperature of their crust, have atmospheres that are dense in organic compounds. Though it renders them a challenge to colonize, this anomaly also helps to increase the agricultural output.

With an atmosphere saturated by complex chemical compounds, life on this planet becomes interesting indeed if one does not breathe through a filter. Though the inevitable wandering thoughts make serious scientific research a bit difficult, it cannot be denied that everyone who lives here is really, really happy.

With an atmosphere that was once saturated by complex chemical compounds, life on this planet was challenging. Application of terraforming technologies, however, has rendered the effects of the air less intense.

With lava rifts that pulse constantly and vast networks of minor volcanoes, two things are very clear about this planet: 1. Industry can be powered cheaply and efficiently; and 2. Inhabitants must watch where they step.
Applying enormous amounts of energy and grappling with gravitational alterations, the previously uncontrollable geothermic activity of the planet is now somewhat less intense.

While the beasts of this planet were first described as "giant," "primal," and "impressive," a more accurate description would have been "clever, silent, and ravenous." Though they are eagerly hunted and in fact are a good food source, few people enjoy living on a planet where the food pyramid is in fact a circle.
While the beasts of this planet were first described as "giant," "primal," and "impressive," these days the adjectives would tend to "controlled," "manageable," and "delicious."
Described by explorers using adjectives like moist, damp, wet, aqueous, soft, lush, and well-hydrated, this planet offers abundant plant and animal life but will certainly be difficult to build upon.
Described by explorers using adjectives like moist, damp, wet, aqueous, soft, lush, and well-hydrated, newer travel guides to the galaxy now indicate that it is mostly harmless.

For those who like their rock and roll on a planetary level, this is the ideal home. Be warned, however, that though geo-physicists will adore it, it makes for nervous inhabitants and expensive construction.
By manipulating the magnetic core, stabilizing continental drift, and improving construction techniques, the problems in daily life caused by seismic activity have been notably reduced.

With an unusually long orbital ellipse, the planet has very long seasons and thus is exposed to extremes of cold in winter and heat in summer. While this is fascinating for scientific experiment, it is difficult for agriculture and makes everyday life stressful.

While the long orbital ellipse remains a fact of life, the application of terraforming sciences, advanced architecture, and improved agriculture has changed it from a health risk into a quaint tourist adventure.

While frequent and heavy meteor showers deliver precious metals for free, they also make life dangerous and require continual repairs to any exposed object. Radioactive and loaded with heavy isotopes, the meteors also wreak havoc with scientific research (and researchers).

For the first time in the history of the universe, the phrase "killer satellites" actually has a practical meaning. Thanks to cheap and robust sources of energy and heavily shielded orbitals, major meteor threats are neutralized high in the atmosphere.
The unusually dense core of this planet gives it abnormally high gravity for its size. Architecture and industry must be adapted to deal with this. In addition, daily life is tiring and difficult.
By the simple and straightforward process of bleeding excess gravitons across hyperdimensions into a parallel universe, the previously extreme gravity of the planet has been somewhat reduced.

Though not lacking in dirt, the planet is surprisingly low in the nutrients and microbes that turn it into a rich compound that stimulates organic life. As a result, agricultural prospects are worse than usual.
The soil of this planet, once sterile and barren, is now much richer in the organic life necessary for agriculture.

Exceedingly cold winters and large continental masses drive this planet through cycles of violent weather. This results in heavy wear and tear on infrastructure, and makes farming--and life in general--unpleasant..
Controlled global warming, advanced thermo-efficient architecture, and really warm parkas have greatly lessened the negative effects of this anomaly.
The content of this planet's soil is acidic and metallic. Not only is it difficult to grow food under these conditions, but the corrosive properties cause trouble for machines and electronics.
Thanks to technologies based on terraforming sciences, the once poisonous soil of this planet has been somewhat improved.

A large, liquid ferrous core gives this planet strong magnetic fields that fluctuate unpredictably. In order to counter this, much of the work done by industry and science has to undergo the expense of being carefully controlled and shielded.
Once directed non-baryonic magnetic flux technology was reduced to handheld size, the negative impacts of this anomaly were greatly reduced.
Basically a big ball of silica and dirt, the planet's crust is abnormally poor in metals and minerals. Both life and industry struggle to adapt in this situation.
A number of major efforts, primarily terraforming and meteor harvesting, have reduced the problems caused by this anomaly.

An odd remnant of a past, lost civilization, the upper atmosphere of this planet is full of drifting debris. There is a cost to removing these remnants, and space-based experiments as well as satellites must be either expensively protected or often replaced.
Though it took time, patience, and very large nets, much of the orbital debris that circulated the planet has been removed or dumped planetside for recycling.

Toxic elements in the atmosphere and the soil make this planet difficult to survive on. It is difficult to grow food except in protected laboratories, and the unpleasantness of daily life weighs on the inhabitants.
Dust-based micro-machining is in its infancy, but basic nano-factories using that technology have done much to convert the toxic chemicals into harmless organic compounds.
Naturally occurring sulfur fumaroles cause highly acidic rain on this planet. This places heavy constraints on architecture and transport as well as creating a disagreeable atmosphere for the locals.
Partially by reducing the effects of the fumaroles and partially by hardening the infrastructure, many of the problems caused by this anomaly have been alleviated.

Naturally high levels of Electro-Magnetic Radiation can cause havoc with an electronic or mechanical apparatus. Technology must be either shielded or frequently repaired, making both industry and daily life expensive.
Thanks to the work of an under-appreciated genius, much of the excess EMR that caused trouble on this planet has been converted into children's toys.

High levels of cosmic rays coupled with naturally occurring sources such as radon make this planet a dangerous place. There is a high risk of cancer-related diseases, and the radiation levels complicate scientific experimentation.
By developing and improving the ozone layer and atmosphere while better insulating construction, a large part of the dangerous effects of this radiation has been removed.

An unfortunate side effect of Tan-Erbo's horticultural tampering, these large, carnivorous, orange plants will aggressively defend their territory. While they are potentially dangerous, they also have delicious fruit that can be used to make a wide variety of excellent candies. There are two risks when colonizing this planet, then; aggressive foliage and tooth decay.

Experiments with certain behavior-controlling luxury resources has produced an interesting side effect. When applied planet-wide, the compound nicknamed "Trikker Treats" has the effect of reducing aggressivity in both plant and animal species. As part of an anomaly reduction process, Hellgourds, while still territorial, can be rendered merely "annoying" instead of "murderous."

The atmosphere shows unusually high traces of Dust, and that Dust shows a tendency to communicate and network to the detriment of your systems. While this does not prevent colonization of the planet, it will make industrial exploitation difficult until a permanent solution can be found.

A brilliant young mathematician named Ial Adave has developed the Dust Manipulation Transformations, a series of algorithms that greatly improve the understanding of networking protocols and communication in Dust interactions. Using this, many of the "ripple" effects caused by hostile Dust interactions can now be dampened or suppressed altogether.

You have apparently discovered a planet that was a battleground during the Dust Wars. As a result, it is a haven of unexploded ordinance, biological and technological viruses, and other unpleasant detritus. While it is habitable, it would best be colonized by citizens with nerves of steel and good reflexes.

An unlikely source of expertise has been discovered in the form of an ancient Virtual Endless. Familiar with much of the technology and techniques, Kyuind Neuil has been a great help in lessening the infections, explosions, and attacks. The planet could even be pleasant one day...

This planet was inhabited by a highly advanced race that died off when a massive volcanic eruption induced a prolonged winter. The knowledge of their civilization was meticulously documented and stored in bunkers scattered across the planet. Clearly, they expected to rise up after the winter and continue their evolution. Sadly, the bunkers sit unlocked and unused, and the people have returned to the dust. Their knowledge, however, is yours to explore.

A warning beacon in the middle of an entire nebula rich with Dust tells its story. Due to poorly-controlled research, a strain of Dust ran wild and self-replicated out of control. By the time it was reined in, entire planetary systems had been converted to Dust, and no food remained for the handful of surviving researchers that left this grim note.

This world was once the greatest shipyard of the Concrete Endless. The skies above the planet darkened with the enormous spacedocks that worked day and night, building and repairing fleets. While much of the technology is lost, the platforms still provide both living space and planetary defense.

The interior of this planet is riddled with cave systems, with some caverns large enough to house small cities. In addition, an excess of quartz formations means that natural light penetrates in some cases several kilometers below the surface. As a result, entire populations can be hidden underground, their industries powered by generous geothermal energy.

A thing of branch and root, this hyper-grown tree reaches from within a planet out into space. A strange, single artifact of some biological experiment gone berserk, this "tree" houses cities and oceans.

A natural anomaly whose probable existence is less than zero, this series of natural quantum-linked transport gates link the planets' surfaces with various points in the star system. Space-time is full of bridges, shortcuts, and holes, allowing rapid transport throughout the system.

These planetary rings remain in motion around a dead star that has been reduced to a tiny black hole. The emanations of the black hole, combined with the metals and chemicals in the rings, have turned the entire anomaly into a sort of crucible. When ships pass through, they are aged and hardened. When heroes pass through, those that survive speak of ancient voices and lost knowledge.

Due to its location with respect to nearby stars, dark matter concentrations, metal veins, and planetary bodies, there is an enormous magnetic flux traversing the planet. The effect is powerful enough to drive "perpetual motion" machines, generating a free and inexhaustible supply of energy. It has also been harnessed to create levitation effects, greatly simplifying transport infrastructure.

The Third Law of Thermodynamics states that increased disorder and decay is inevitable. This law is immutable and inevitable throughout all the worlds of all the galaxies. Except here. For whatever reason, entropy in the system increases at a measurably slower rate than anywhere else, meaning that it takes far longer for things to rust, weaken, and otherwise age.

Explorers have discovered a large industrial installation, decorated primarily in red and green, hidden under the snows of the northernmost part of this planet. This surprisingly vast infrastructure turns raw materials into finished products, specializing in goods that are small, robust, and colorful. While the details are not clear, reports are that the indigenous workers seem to refer to themselves as Expert Light FabricatorS.

What first appeared to be a planet in very tight orbit around a sun turns out to be the remains of an Endless power generation plant. Full of advanced particle engineering and protected by an Orichalcix shell, this installation once produced vast quantities of microwave energy that was beamed to a grid of now-destroyed transmission satellites.

What first appeared to be a planet in very tight orbit around a sun turns out to be the remains of an Endless power generation plant. Full of advanced particle engineering and protected by an Orichalcix shell, this installation once produced vast quantities of microwave energy that was beamed to a grid of now-destroyed transmission satellites.

At the height of their technology, the Endless were able to tap planetary cores in order to exploit geothermal energy. Side benefits of these advanced installations included significant advances in geological sciences as well as mining of rare minerals and rare states of matter.

At the height of their technology, the Endless were able to tap planetary cores in order to exploit geothermal energy. Side benefits of these advanced installations included significant advances in geological sciences as well as mining of rare minerals and rare states of matter.

A combination of probe, sentry, and archive, this ancient and derelict deep space installation was certainly the work of the Endless. Given its current battered condition it was most likely positioned to study a collapsar. Still, its thick adamantine shell was able to protect some of its contents, and the lessons from its construction will certainly help our own navies.

A combination of probe, sentry, and archive, this ancient and derelict deep space installation was certainly the work of the Endless. Given its current battered condition it was most likely positioned to study a collapsar. Still, its thick adamantine shell was able to protect some of its contents, and the lessons from its construction will certainly help our own navies.

The Endless, masters of stellar navigation and deeply aware of the structure of the galaxy, left a most curious installation at this point in space-time. To the best understanding of faction scientists, this is a point where magnetic, gravitational, baryonic fields generated a slight ripple in the fabric of reality. The role of this ruin was once to harvest quadrinix from whatever matter passed through this discontinuity.

The Endless, masters of stellar navigation and deeply aware of the structure of the galaxy, left a most curious installation at this point in space-time. To the best understanding of faction scientists, this is a point where magnetic, gravitational, baryonic fields generated a slight ripple in the fabric of reality. The role of this ruin was once to harvest quadrinix from whatever matter passed through this discontinuity.

Even in the eyes of the Endless this project must have appeared mad. What has apparently been discovered in this system is the remains of a platform that was used to harvest materials from the core of a dying star, and only inordinate quantities of orichalcix and siderite gave the effort a whisper of a chance. The output of the factory was a now-inert form of Dust; its less pragmatic product is enormous prestige and a stream of eager adventure tourists.

Even in the eyes of the Endless this project must have appeared mad. What has apparently been discovered in this system is the remains of a platform that was used to harvest materials from the core of a dying star, and only inordinate quantities of orichalcix and siderite gave the effort a whisper of a chance. The output of the factory was a now-inert form of Dust; its less pragmatic product is enormous prestige and a stream of eager adventure tourists.

At a best guess, it will be over five hundred years before scientists discover why the Endless built this structure, and several thousand before it can be replicated. Fixed at a certain distance from a selected wormhole, it apparently drops and retrieves probes that pass from one side of a wormhole, but do not come out on the other side. Where the probes go, and what they learn, is not currently comprehensible.

At a best guess, it will be over five hundred years before scientists discover why the Endless built this structure, and several thousand before it can be replicated. Fixed at a certain distance from a selected wormhole, it apparently drops and retrieves probes that pass from one side of a wormhole, but do not come out on the other side. Where the probes go, and what they learn, is not currently comprehensible.

This appears to be an Endless structure with no visible means of propulsion. After penetrating the outer shell and the defenses, tactical scientific strike squads discovered a door. Upon opening the door, they saw an identical door opening a few meters ahead of them, encircled by polarity-reversed anti-versions of themselves that were also trying to decide what to do. Apparently, Dust-enhanced Heroes who study their counterparts through this aperture achieve certain benefits, but the effects are little discussed and poorly understood.

This appears to be an Endless structure with no visible means of propulsion. After penetrating the outer shell and the defenses, tactical scientific strike squads discovered a door. Upon opening the door, they saw an identical door opening a few meters ahead of them, encircled by polarity-reversed anti-versions of themselves that were also trying to decide what to do. Apparently, Dust-enhanced Heroes who study their counterparts through this aperture achieve certain benefits, but the effects are little discussed and poorly understood.

Perhaps the strangest Endless installation yet discovered, this quadrinix-powered grid of Dust-constructed satellites appears to be using the trans-dimensional qualities of its fuel to 'summon' organic compounds from elsewhere in this or another galaxy. Creating a constant 'rain' of nutrient-rich soil particles, the arables surfaces of the planet are sowed with eternally fertile soils.

Perhaps the strangest Endless installation yet discovered, this quadrinix-powered grid of Dust-constructed satellites appears to be using the trans-dimensional qualities of its fuel to 'summon' organic compounds from elsewhere in this or another galaxy. Creating a constant 'rain' of nutrient-rich soil particles, the arables surfaces of the planet are sowed with eternally fertile soils.
The mineral and energy resources of this planet fall within standard norms for its type. No unusual or valuable resources have been identified with the current levels of technology and science.

Strategic Resources are critical to empire development; they must be discovered and exploited in order to obtain more advanced technologies and industries. Once a planet with a resource is colonized, the entire empire benefits from the associated gains as long as travel is possible to and from that system. The more resources of the same type are gathered, the more bonuses they will bring to empire development.

Strategic Resources are critical to empire development; they must be discovered and exploited in order to obtain more advanced technologies and industries. Once a planet with a resource is colonized, the entire empire benefits from the associated gains as long as travel is possible to and from that system. The more resources of the same type are gathered, the more bonuses they will bring to empire development.

A high-isotope titanium ore, this exceptionally strong and dense metal has innumerable applications in a high-technology society. Control of 4 or more units of Titanium-70 greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

A word coined by contracting "hyper-deuterium", this is a high isotope of hydrogen whose extreme density makes it an ideal source of fuel. Control of 4 or more units of Hyperium greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

Generally found near planetary cores, this high-pressure phase of iron is formed only under extreme conditions. A gray, hexagon-shaped rock, it has the greatest strength and hardness of any known material. Control of 4 or more units of Hexaferrum greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

As dangerous as it is powerful, high technology (and high energies) are necessary to capture anti-matter in industrially useful quantities. Interestingly, anti-neutrons and anti-protons can be captured in certain parts of planetary magnetic fields where cosmic rays interact with baryonic matter. Control of 4 or more units of Anti-Matter greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

Discovered as a byproduct of the nuclear fission process within a star, the properties of this orange metal make it excellent for anything that must put up with extreme conditions. Control of 4 or more units of Orichalcix greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

Siderite is created from iron and other transition metals that exist in an interim state between solid and liquid in planetary cores. When released from the pressure it forms a metallic plasma, resulting in a powerful energy source. Control of 4 or more units of Siderite greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

This strange alloy, composed of many Lanthanides, comes from planets or asteroids which survived close passage by a black hole, wormhole, or other powerful gravitational anomaly. Though it shows outstanding properties of durability, hardness, and strength, it requires exceedingly advanced smelting systems that include high-energy non-baryonic particle streams. Control of 4 or more units of Adamantian greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

A material that exists in phases between matter, anti-matter, and alternate universes, quadrinix has the highest energy density of any known and containable substance. Control of 4 or more units of Quadrinix greatly reduces construction cost for anything that requires it.

Luxury Resources grant you Trade and Dust bonuses, which increase if you hold a Monopoly of a resource. Once a planet with a resource is colonized, the entire empire benefits from the associated gains as long as you can travel to and from that system. The more resources of the same type are gathered, the more bonuses they will bring to empire development.

This red spice is derived from a lichen that thrives on coral reefs but can be found anywhere there are traces of water. It is prized for its strong, spicy flavor as well as its notable effects on biological health and longevity.

This is a form of mushroom that contains a potent nootropic (cognition-enhancing) drug. A remnant of Endless biogenetics, It is derived from fungal spores that can survive deep space. It is highly sought after in spite of its side effects (craving for pastries, rapid hair growth).

This is a curative substance that predates the Endless schism; it is an early product of Dust enhancements that is not merely curative for both biological and mechanical beings but also enhances empathy.

To aid their travels across the galaxy, the Endless seeded many planets with Hydromiel -- a machine / organic mix that builds nutrients from any form of soil or rock and converts them into indescribably delicious blobs of grape-sized fruit.

This naturally occurring liquid metal alloy displays a rainbow of iridescent colors. Its unique structure, a combination of crystal and liquid, has made it a highly valued trade good as it resonates, vibrates, and changes color regardless of its physical state.

Amethyst-colored crystal accreted around a graviton pearl that in turn contains pure anti-matter, Void Stones have enormous industrial utility. Due to their ability to manipulate gravity fields, Void Stones can be used for all manner of transport, construction, and practical jokes.

The only known occurring anti-gemstone, the unique lensing properties of Jadonyx make it very useful in advanced tools and machines. It also has many practical military applications for improving weapon systems and ship defenses.

These strange crystals emit ionic waves on similar frequencies to the brainwaves of sentient beings. They can soothe and enhance brain activity, but when excited by certain subatomic particles they interfere both with mental activity and quantum computing devices.
An exceedingly agreeable aroma wafts from this orange-pink plant when it is burned. Sought after for its potent effects on intellectual creativity, it is valuable as a resource and for trade.

Sourced from a plant that apparently survives by absorbing dark matter from its environment, Meta-Entactogen emits radiation on very unusual spectra. When ingested it makes the 'aura' of an individual visible to others, which greatly improves communication efforts.

This strange plant with innumerable tiny crescent-shaped leaves can be safely ingested. It creates a sensation of peace and happiness, and is used as a natural relaxant and sedative. It is also a useful tool to keep rowdy populations compliant.

This flower has the unique property of being able to live symbiotically with almost every known plant life. It is visible as tiny, curling petals all over an affected plant's leaves and stems. Defensive of its host, it attacks predators and cures disease and infection.

This planet was once a vibrant world of the 'Concrete' faction of the Endless civilization. Remnants of buildings, transport systems, and everyday fixtures give a glimpse of the industrial sophistication of their culture, and show the heights to which any people can hope to climb.

Once a world inhabited by the 'Virtual' faction of the Endless civilization, the strange objects they left behind are incomprehensible to those who are not attuned to Dust. For those who are, however, these artifacts can give powerful enhancements.

The two great factions of the Endless, the 'Concretes' and the 'Virtuals', were once a single people discovering the myriad mysteries of the universe. More advanced than current science, the artifacts they left behind are useful in improving ship capacity and design.

An uncountable number of civilizations have risen and fallen across the vastness of the galaxy. This discovery is of one of those that grew and flourished before disappearing. Given the warlike nature of these artifacts, it is likely that this people excelled in ship-to-ship combat.

The universe is an impossibly vast and strange place, and the planets one finds there are equally amazing. Many of them have anomalies--unusual geologic, atmospheric or biological characteristics and even, on occasion, the remains of ancient civilizations. Proceed at your own risk...
Probes indicate the presence on this planet of a natural phenomenon that is both extremely rare and extremely strange.
In a pattern that is being seen across the galaxy, the signature of previously dormant Endless technology has been noted on this planet.

The resource (if any) present on this planet. There are two kinds of resources: Strategic and Luxury. Strategic Resources are critical to empire development; they must be discovered and exploited in order to obtain more advanced technologies and industries. Luxury Resources grant you Trade and Dust bonuses, which increase if you hold a Monopoly of a resource. Once a planet with a resource is colonized, the entire empire benefits from the associated gains as long as you can travel to and from that system. The more resources of the same type are gathered, the more bonuses they will bring to empire development.
When applicable, the negative effects of an anomaly can be reduced.
When applicable, the full effects of an Endless wonder can be retrieved.
