Drop the Population Unit on a colonized Planet.
A lost outpost of the 'Concrete' Endless, the information stored in this defunct temple of learning gives an immediate bonus to all scientific development in the system.

This is clearly a relic of the 'Virtual' Endless, who put their minds into computer systems and let their bodies die. A node of a greater data network that is now lost, the system is designed to share scientific knowledge among the planets that orbit this sun.

A non-violent branch of the Virtual Endless, the Persuasive Mind scholars focused on victory through non-military means. This outpost contains possibly the galaxy's greatest knowledge base dealing with persuasion, propaganda, and public relations.

This sub-faction of the Concrete Endless had an abiding love for architecture and materials science. Secrets of their studies are contained in the records within this site, leading to an enormous increase in construction efficiency.
Seduced by the glory of architecture and design, the Brotherhood left many sites across the galaxies that contain deeply cherished secrets of process, production, and polish.

Unusual for a Virtual sub-group, the Congregation studied construction and architecture. The notes and minutes left here detail how to rapidly grow industrial production, most likely with the goal of making planets hospitable to the energy-dependent bodies of the Virtuals.
TEMPLE OF THE AURA OF GLORY

While they do not admit it, certain Endless colonies governed alien populations through demagoguery, exploitation, propaganda, and good PR. This 'religion' was a cover for a group that gleaned information on the most effective methods of leading through subterfuge and guile.

Having studied sociology, anthropology, and psychology in unimaginable depth, a group of researchers founded this institute to further their knowledge. The wisdom contained in its records helps a leader to track, understand, predict, and control the sympathies of their subjects.
A lost outpost of the 'Concrete' Endless, the information stored in this defunct temple of learning gives an immediate bonus to all scientific development in the system.

This is clearly a relic of the 'Virtual' Endless, who put their minds into computer systems and let their bodies die. A node of a greater data network that is now lost, the system is designed to share scientific knowledge among the planets that orbit this sun.

A branch of a splinter group that treated engineering as a holy mission, this particular ruin contains detailed mapping of non-baryonic particle clouds within this solar system. The information permits 'harvesting' of these particles to radically improve transit times within the system.

When the civil war between the 'Concrete' and 'Virtual' Endless erupted, the Concrete's ignorance of their foes was a crippling handicap. This is a branch of a library that was developed to share information and experience between Concrete forces, helping them defeat their foes in this system.
TEMPLE OF THE ORDER OF ORICHALCIX

This is one of the few surviving temples of this splinter society of celibate warrior cosmonauts. It contains much of their lore, which dealt with ways to improve the efficiency of starship components.

A non-violent branch of the Virtual Endless, the Persuasive Mind scholars focused on victory through non-military means. This outpost contains possibly the galaxy's greatest knowledge base dealing with persuasion, propaganda, and public relations.

This sub-faction of the Concrete Endless had an abiding love for architecture and materials science. Secrets of their studies are contained in the records within this site, leading to an enormous increase in construction efficiency.

A truly rare find in the galaxy, information contained within this structure was left by Concrete Endless who had studied the system for many years. The data in particular explains the seasons and weather patterns of all the planets, with precise explanations of optimal growing periods.

An important leader of the Strategist sub-faction of the Virtual Endless, the entity known as "Haion Hartuun" proselytized the fact that an effective defense is based on knowledge of the enemy. This listening post was created to gather information on hostile forces and share it among planets in the system.
Seduced by the glory of architecture and design, the Brotherhood left many sites across the galaxies that contain deeply cherished secrets of process, production, and polish.

Unusual for a Virtual sub-group, the Congregation studied construction and architecture. The notes and minutes left here detail how to rapidly grow industrial production, most likely with the goal of making planets hospitable to the energy-dependent bodies of the Virtuals.

One of the few groupings that contained both Concrete and Virtual members, the SIT studied all aspects of trade and commerce such as logistics, production, and marketing. This site of learning contains many of its secrets.

As they explored the galaxies, certain Endless known as "Commerce Lords" left exacting records explaining what goods and resources existed on what planets and in what systems. Created as the corresponding database for this system, this information is a boon for trade.
TEMPLE OF THE AURA OF GLORY

While they do not admit it, certain Endless colonies governed alien populations through demagoguery, exploitation, propaganda, and good PR. This 'religion' was a cover for a group that gleaned information on the most effective methods of leading through subterfuge and guile.

Having studied sociology, anthropology, and psychology in unimaginable depth, a group of researchers founded this institute to further their knowledge. The wisdom contained in its records helps a leader to track, understand, predict, and control the sympathies of their subjects.

Advances in soil biology have opened the gate to new, low-impact farming methods that reduce the need for water, fertilizer, and sunlight. In addition, crops will be able to grow in extremes of temperature and soil quality.
The ability to adapt plant DNA to its environment, and transfer those learned traits to successive generations, creates a boom in healthy, disease-resistant, long-lived crops.
Improving techniques in fertilizing, crop rotation, genetics, storage, and transport all lead to very efficient and high-volume food production.

Artificial life forms, and biological forms "taught" to create useful additives, can provide efficient forms of production. They require enormous scale to be practical, however, and the most effective techniques include harnessing lunar gravity to maximize water cycles.

In order to maximize the output of agricultural land, irreplaceable groundwater, highly concentrated fertilizers, and genetically engineering seeds are used in great quantities. The damage to the land will be long-lasting, but food volumes increase notably.

Mastery of increasingly miniaturized thermodynamics permits the creation of heat exchange systems small enough to fit into almost any item. Using these technologies, the risk of food spoiling is essentially reduced to zero.

Technologies of transport and refrigeration tied to the monitoring of lifestyles and behavioral analytics all come together to ensure that the 30-40% of the food supply that is usually wasted or thrown out becomes available for consumption. An incredibly complex system, it nevertheless creates an enormous boost in food availability.

Crops are no longer recognizable as the plants from which they sprung. Nano-enhanced and genetically modified, healthy and immortal plants are food factories that run year-round, regardless of the weather. Continually harvested, self-fertilizing, and auto-regulating, the food supply will simply never run out.
The development of n-way fusion technology permits the creation and exploitation of fuels that are stabler and cheaper, boosting industrial output.

Due to the interaction of gravitational pulls and magnetic fluxes, low-energy paths exist that speed and simplify travel within a system. By also applying advanced magnetics to transport design, this low-cost network facilitates access to the farthest points of the system's limits.

Using advanced computational analysis, the flow of raw materials and manufactured goods can be optimized to an incredibly precise level. The ultimate execution of "just-in-time" commerce across an entire system is a powerful boon to industry.

Far more than the simple application of robotics, advanced computational methods and materials permit the creation of a highly flexible and instantly re-trainable workforce. Flawless, uncomplaining, and efficient, these workers boost both industrial production and R&D.

Trains change their schedules to arrive when needed. Over-crowded buildings grow extra floors. Windows adapt to maximize ambient light. Systems that handle air and waste scale up and down based on time of day, season, and long-term trends. With sufficiently advanced AI systems and self-aware materials, the self-organizing city is now a possibility.
Now on a level with rudimentary Endless technology, the industrial base of the system has become intelligent, self-adapting, sustainable, and autonomous.

In order to properly tap into the exploding market of alien tourists, a special infrastructure must be put into place. Travel between planets is a simple problem; travel between cultures is something else indeed. In order to effectively provide an interesting destination for aliens, enormous work is required in public infrastructures, hotels, restaurants, spaceports, and--most particularly--toilets.

This term for the tax system, an "in" joke between bureaucrats, indicates that the government is careful about picking up all the Dust it can, regardless of where it is (NP-hard math is required to plot the travel routes of the collectors).

Trade and industrial systems are providing luxuries in such an efficient and inexpensive manner that the faction is now able to export, sell, and otherwise profit from a booming luxury trade. This has never before been possible, given previous constraints of scarcity and disposable income.

Traditional taxation systems are often slow to change, and risk generating harmful economic behavior--like increasing savings when consumption is needed. Adaptive taxes, however, change instantaneously not only based on economic trends but according to product or service, and by location. As a result, ideal economic behavior is encouraged while government coffers are filled.

A problem with traditional costing systems -- public or private -- is that they are slow to change. Adaptive tarification, however, applies a highly sophisticated series of psychological, educational, cultural, and political analyses to ensure maximization of investment. Taxes, pricing, import duties, R&D bonuses, and all manner of financial stimuli can be integrated into a single, highly profitable model.

The application of advanced AI routines to individual and company decisions on cash usage are surprisingly powerful. By balancing factors as diverse as weather, raw material prices, real estate trends, and political trends, money can be spent in ways that generate a 'perfect' return on investment.

In the final analysis, the most valuable substance in the universe is Dust. Once the complexities of pan-galactic trade and finance are mastered, the final step in maximizing revenue and value is to exploit the fact that the currency of the known universe is alive and intelligent, and the line between a good or service and its payment is increasingly fluid. Once the fundamental nature of Dust's existence as both currency and good, theory and technology, is mastered, a state of Revenue Zen can be achieved.

Before any great scientific advances can be found, there must be money to do the research. By setting up a series of long-term agreements between public and private entities, future investments into large-scale, ambitious projects can be assured.

These create artificial magnetospheres around planets in order to compensate for the lack of a liquid ferrous core. They provide stable environments on planets that would otherwise be bombarded by radiation.

This is more than simply determining ways to collapse the wave functions of photons or study technologies to bend their paths. Fundamental research into the nature of leptons is part of the institutes' charter, and discoveries should have great effects on the knowledge of light, gravity, and dark energy.

This is more than simply determining ways to collapse the wave functions of photons or study technologies to bend their paths. Fundamental research into the nature of leptons is part of the institutes' charter, and these labs are expected to yield gravity-manipulating technologies.

Thanks to the reactive capacities of etched graviton sensors, science develops the capacity to create shielding effects that isolate objects from the effect of gravity-bearing "graviton" particles. Critical space-oriented technologies can now be developed and tested anywhere.

Advances learned from deep space operations and the science of dark matter and dark energy generate important advances in science. Cutting-edge research centers that further this knowledge can provide a boost in technological development.

Science has come to the point where anomalies can be recreated and studied under laboratory conditions, if those labs are built from highly resistant materials and systems. The anomalies unders study include black holes, entropy, stars, and dark matter.

Due to the low gravity vacuum that surrounds asteroids, they provide a perfect location for a center of research into the uses and effects of low gravitation. A side effect of this knowledge, of course, is the ability to use the technology and the asteroids themselves to improve system defense.

Previously, option trading was a straightforward if technical calculation based on Black-Scholes and similar pricing models. However, with the inclusion of relativistic and non-relativistic frames these calculations become terrifically complex; any star system that can build the sophisticated computing and trading systems needed to deal in these options gains substantial benefits.

This is an exchange where miners, gemologists, and other rock collectors come from all over the system to trade in their wares. It is under the management of a loose confederation of mining companies, known as the Borer's Guild.

Part of a long-term investment program in infrastructure, the creation of space elevators across the system to transfer goods and people from planet to orbit is a resounding success. Without key materials and techniques adopted from other societies this would not have been possible.

Whether it is a physical reaction or an emotional one, traversing a wormhole or using similar forms of transport tends to be overwhelming for travelers - whether tourism, business, or military. Strategic placement of a network of giant, duty-free spaceport 'starmalls' gives these ever-greater numbers of travelers a place to visit, relax, shop, meet, and blow off steam.

Always a barrier to trade, communication between disparate species renders negotiation slow and risky. By creating translators that understand language, body language, social norms, psychology, history, popular culture, customs, and tradition, trade agreements become rapid and painless.

The most valuable commodity in advanced society is information. Ultimately, the value of knowing when, where, and for how much to sell a good or service outweighs the value of the thing itself. With the development of exchanges that pass information at quantum-tunneled speeds, the myth of 'perfect knowledge' in economics has truly become a reality.

With vastly improved methods for selecting, growing, and harvesting foods, it is possible to deliver any known dish or ingredient anywhere within a colonized world. Local markets have essentially become infinitely large.

A complex question has always arisen around the power of a colonial government to administer its own affairs without too much interference from distant, once-important home worlds. Now that technology has rapidly developed to the point where colonies are autonomous, stable, and productive, most factions tend to adopt a 'hands-off' policy for laws and regulations -- in return for a constant supply of cash.

Applying increasingly advanced algorithms to networks is a step towards a major goal of the Sowers: Effortless, simultaneous, bandwidth-efficient consensus. As all Sowers strive towards a common goal, they are greatly pleased at any possibility of effortless and unified decision-making that accelerates their progress.

Wars between content creators, infrastructure owners, end users, governments, and corporations sapped much of the value from the ability to network a society. By building open access to sources of research, entertainment, and news from around the universe, a boom in the use of information is paralleled by a boom in public opinion.

Tradition, religion, and social mores tend to keep a tight rein on body evolution and the physical alteration of an individual's organism. However, for an enormous number of reasons (political, economic, and practical) governments tend more and more to let individuals freely change their physical structure through augmentations, grafts, clones, implantations, tattoos, electronic etchings, and other alterations.

What happens when society advances to the point where all basic needs are handled by automated and indestructible systems? Labor becomes an option, and the greatest challenge is the effective use of free time.

The creation of buildings that absorb various forms of passive energy (ambient heat, radiation, light, etc.) and convert it into usable energy creates a boom in inexpensive, temperature-indifferent housing.

A great problem with increasing population can be the sudden increase in population density for beings that are not used to crowded habitats. Techniques of insulating individuals, family groups, and communities through a combination of architecture and urban psychology permits greater densities of population.

Advanced soil and plant biology results in the creation of living structures that self-heal, increase in size, and provide nourishment and waste recycling. Advanced shielding further allows these environments to exist in the most inhospitable environments.

Advanced soil and plant biology can potentially provide "living" structures that self-heal, increase in size, and provide nourishment and waste recycling. However, the addition of shared field technology to stabilize the atmosphere and insulate the populace from EM radiation gives these environments a higher level of security.

Thanks to intelligent materials evolved through the principles of inorganic evolution, inexpensive and automated habitats can be grown in any conditions by materials that 'learn' and adapt to their environment.
A few Quonset huts, a perimeter fence, supply depots, and a lot of brave adventurers -- the starting point of a colony looks the same, no matter what species does it.

By using advanced manipulation of particles that allow for the laboratory recreation of atmospheric science, it is easy to do a detailed study of atmosphere and geology in order to take advantage of a planet's unique properties.

The ability to track individual water molecules through the water cycle provides an instantaneous picture of absorption, evaporation, and precipitation across every planet. A gold mine of data is produced that improves agriculture, industrial usage, and private consumption of the galaxy's most precious resource.

Increased understanding of unusual particles and gravitational interactions allows system-wide installation of protective fields that stabilize planetary infrastructures. By avoiding unwanted interference from non-baryonic radiation and particle surges, elements of risk and chance are removed from industrial processes. As a result, they become more reliable, predictable, and fruitful.

By constructing this net of satellites at great distance from a star (on the order of 40k to 50k AU's), a system's frontier is effectively extended due to improved signal reception (detection) and increased government broadcast range (influence).
A joint collaboration between comm scientists and dissident recruiters, assets and systems are set up to provide information on hostile fleets.
Untangling the mysteries of quantum entanglement leads to the unexpected capacity to sense the presence of incoming ships and fleets through lepton filtering.

The application of imaginary math to real problems has provided an unexpected side benefit -- improved sensor efficiency. The inventor refuses to divulge details, murmuring only about negative, time-reversed tachyons.

A great advance in cloaking systems is made by particle lensing -- using magnetics and gravity, the motion of particles is controlled to conceal ships and installations. When coupled with advanced data analysis, it becomes increasingly difficult for enemy assets to analyze and understand signal patterns.

The universe is even more interconnected than previously believed. The building of advanced sensing devices in five disparate systems permits a level of predictive analysis that makes an empire invulnerable.

Zeal and idealism can move worlds, and perhaps even empires. A series of highly advanced factory systems, managed by believers in the Pilgrim cause, create a powerful base of industry that is efficient, wasteless, and inexpensive.

More than just a series of organizations, a military-industrial complex is an enormous chain of interdependent entities. Tying together government, industry, education, and research, a properly structured MIC is a very efficient way to maximize the use of scarce or precious resources for government benefit.

Relentless warriors, the Hissho continually improve the battle capabilities of themselves and their ships. This center shares battle data and continually runs scenarios, improving the effectiveness of ships that are not on deployment and sharing design and material concepts with the shipyards.
A by-product of advanced shielding, adaptations to this military defense technology can be applied to industrial sites, protecting them from exposure to extreme conditions.

The great variance between the levels of radiation and light in different star systems makes agriculture an expensive process of continual adaptation. However, the use of shield effect technology can simplify this, allowing local re-creation of ideal or standard conditions to speed and simplify crop development.

Turning the image of aliens from scary, unknown entities into friendly-but-different beings requires large-scale explanation and training. A government process that brings aliens into news, entertainment, and education in a factual and integrative manner results in a populace that favors contact, trade, and communication with other factions.

A necessary precaution when all forms of computers and communications are in a constant state of test and update, these highly resilient systems are backed up and refreshed in real-time. Transport, entertainment, research, and business can thus continue uninterrupted in spite of a populace obsessed with buying and testing all manner of upgrades and refinements to everyday technology.

Through improvements in technology, primarily construction and transport systems, the Automatons are able to grow their orbiting ships into colossal size. These enormous Orbital Platforms are symbiotic with any ship that is within the solar system, and the mutual support provides advantages in generating Food, Industry, Dust, and Science.

Leaving their system by choice or by obligation, the Pilgrim society has prepared a wondrous traveling vessel. Should it survive the rigors of the journey, the ship will be used to recreate the lost home, improvement for improvement, in a new system. True to its name, this great vessel of the Pilgrims will continue its quest across the galaxy.

This is an enormous undertaking that requires the backing of government, universities, and industry. In order to make significant strides in scientific research and the advancement of next-generation technologies, all industrial output and industrial corporations that are not needed to supply infrastructure elements are turned towards advanced science and scientific research.

While industry and industrial research has its value, a decision is taken by the government to maximize Dust by turning all non-essential industry into financially negotiable instruments via a galaxy-wide hedge fund. These, in turn, will be traded for Dust on the polymarket, providing an enormous boost to empire income.

Using lessons from hardy strains of bacteria and extremophilic eukaryotea, basic soil biology can be changed to improve nutrition and waste cycles. These changes will, however, propagate planet-wide over time.

A first step in creating hardy, sustainable (and non-toxic) local crops is to integrate known genomes and plant cycles into alien ecologies. Using advanced scanning and analysis known and alien plant types can be joined into relatively harmless produce.

By dedicating increasing amounts of land to agricultural production, the planet is becoming an efficient and organized provider of food. Less land and money is available for other uses, however, as complex tasks of refrigeration, transport, storage, irrigation, fertilizer, and processing consume resources.

Every new planet has its own specificities and challenges. Before great leaps can be made in exploiting a planet's resources, the first step is to adapt known and reliable industrial processes to the new environment. By overcoming challenges in transport, energy, and finance, a firm base for development can be created.

These vast complexes serve a number of critical industrial functions: Production of geothermal energy; mining of planetary cores for specialized materials; advanced materials and geological research; advanced study of plate tectonics.

It was a large and complicated engineering task, but the creation of a planet-wide system of smart materials plus improved logistics has brought this world to the point where any industrial object can be 'printed' in a local factory. While the bonus to production is obvious, the complexity of the infrastructure becomes a dominant factor in the economy.

Founding a colony is both complex and expensive. Using funds and technology from the government and investors, skills from the colonists, and raw materials from the planet, a system must be created to handle investments, loans, salaries, project finance... and taxes.

The discovery of transport via faster-than-light travel and wormholes has added complexity to simple calculations of Net Present Value and rates of return. The development of Atemporal Finance is a new branch of finance, governing cases where space is a variable as important as time.

In order to effectively execute trade and finance in a relativistic frame of reference, new regulatory systems and laws are required in order to control some of the new and unexpected effects of space-time on traditional investment structures. A major agency has been set up, and as it attracts financial institutions, lobbyists, economists, and speculators, it begins to have a major effect on the planet's development.

Data is the lifeblood of science. As new planets are discovered, field scientists set up systems to measure and analyze the biology, geology, and meteorology of the planet and its atmosphere. Collecting, filtering and exploiting this information is a first and critical step.

Building a very large scale particle accelerator will permit the discovery of the existence and characteristics of WIMPs - Weakly Interacting Massive Particles. This will be critical for the understanding of dark matter, dark energy, and nonbaryonic particles in general.

A majority of the planet has been converted into an enormous research institute. Relatively non-polluting, high margin, and education-intensive, it draws companies and agencies to develop the next generation of galaxy-changing technologies. In addition, telepathics can be either augmented or diminished to improve group brainstorming or individual concentration. The cost of the infrastructure is high, however, and other industrial development is necessarily minimized.

Through the use of effective (if clumsy) streams of gravitons, planetary cores can be liquefied and the basics of plate tectonics imposed on a planetoid. This effectively turns the planetary body into a seething cauldron that creates high-value minerals; it may somewhat reduce its value for tourism.

A planet described as "barren" is generally devoid of air, water, and anything else that makes it habitable. Though this sounds unpleasant, there are worse places to live 'out there' and Barren planets also have their value.

Though the climate may be hostile, a desert planet can be rich in valuable resources. "Upgrading" from an even less hospitable planet is still a major task, requiring the creation of atmosphere, some basic level of soils and hydration, and even simple life forms.

While cold is amply available in the 0 Kelvin vacuum of space, the process of applying the correct amount of cold while hydrating a planet is not a simple operation. Atmospheric engineering and an advanced knowledge of water chemistry is needed to complete the process successfully.

Typically done to elevate a less hospitable planet type to Arid, this project requires the creation of viable soils and a functioning, if relatively dry, atmosphere. It is still an enormous investment in energy, raw materials, and time.

Terraforming a planet into a Tundra-type requires sophisticated manipulation of temperature and humidity on a planetary scale. This requires precise thermodynamic control and a great deal of energy, neither of which would be possible without the use of exotic matter.

Rich and varied, a Terran-class planet is one of the most viable and valuable planet types in the universe. Transforming another planet into this type is necessarily an expensive and scientifically complex task. But, like most things in life, it wouldn't be interesting if it were too easy.

Water. An atom of oxygen bound to two simple hydrogens; something minimal and simple but necessary on the scale of a few trillion cubic kilometers to create an ocean world. While the result is a planet potentially wealthy in life and resources, it is not a project for the faint of heart.

Changing any planet type into a world as rich and vibrant as a jungle requires time, dedication, and extremely sophisticated bioengineering. A masterpiece of applied genetics, artificial evolution, and resource utilization, this transformation is only available to the most advanced societies.

It required the combined capacities of three species to develop a reliable gas giant transformation process. Using Automaton terraforming systems, Deuyivan matter phase technology, and Endless gating science, a process has been developed to change the primary element of a gas giant, and even turn it into a telluric planet. That was quite complex, but the really clever part was figuring out how to reverse the process.

It required the combined capacities of three species to develop a reliable gas giant transformation process. Using Automaton terraforming systems, Deuyivan matter phase technology, and Endless gating science, a process has been developed to change the primary element of a gas giant, and even turn it into a telluric planet. That was quite complex, but the really clever part was figuring out how to reverse the process.

It required the combined capacities of three species to develop a reliable gas giant transformation process. Using Automaton terraforming systems, Deuyivan matter phase technology, and Endless gating science, a process has been developed to change the primary element of a gas giant, and even turn it into a telluric planet. That was quite complex, but the really clever part was figuring out how to reverse the process.

It required the combined capacities of three species to develop a reliable gas giant transformation process. Using Automaton terraforming systems, Deuyivan matter phase technology, and Endless gating science, a process has been developed to change the primary element of a gas giant, and even turn it into a telluric planet. That was quite complex, but the really clever part was figuring out how to reverse the process.

There are a number of well-understood tasks that can be done to remove planetary anomalies. Filtering the atmosphere, removing poisons from soil, and stabilizing the magnetic field are all based on familiar, if expensive, processes.

The removal or stabilization of more complex anomalies from a planet is a close kin to the sciences of terraforming. Like them, it requires enormous investments of time and money as well as highly advanced sciences if it is to be done within realistic terms.

The greatest risk to colonizing Terran-type planets is taking their apparently 'friendly' ecosystems for granted. Rigorous scientific testing and analysis are required to study the atmosphere, food chains, proteins, and carbon and nitrogen cycles. In spite of their apparent compatibility, they can be full of rude surprises.

As they teem with animal and plant life, jungle-type planets can be difficult to colonize. Medical supplies are critical to deal with the plethora of exotic fungi, bacteria, poisons, secretions, pollens, spores, and, of course, teeth and claws.

Generally rich in life and highly prized for colonization, ocean-type planets present two major problems: The first is developing a stable aquaculture infrastructure that provides all needed nutrients. The second is dealing with the unimaginably powerful storms and waves that can traverse the entire world with no land to inhibit them.

The discovery of arid plant epigenetics encourages succulent plants (cacti, agave, etc.) to self-evolve in order to better adapt to extreme conditions. It also permits many cash crops to grow in previously impossible biospheres.

The discovery of arid plant epigenetics encourages succulent plants (cacti, agave, etc.) to self-evolve in order to better adapt to extreme conditions. It also permits many cash crops to grow in previously impossible biospheres.

Improvement of the system by which sap moves through weather-resistant plants results in the creation of crop species that can survive harsh weather via freezing and thawing. This opens up many opportunities for colonizing previously uninhabitable areas.

Improvement of the system by which sap moves through weather-resistant plants results in the creation of crop species that can survive harsh weather via freezing and thawing. This opens up many opportunities for colonizing previously uninhabitable areas.

Desert ecosystems are famous for their fragility. With low water levels, delicate soils, and intricate (and easily upset) food chains, they are difficult to reliably and sustainably develop. In fact, their colonization would not be practical without a greatly improved understanding of sustainable development.

Desert ecosystems are famous for their fragility. With low water levels, delicate soils, and intricate (and easily upset) food chains, they are difficult to reliably and sustainably develop. In fact, their colonization would not be practical without a greatly improved understanding of sustainable development.

The ability to colonize Arctic-type planets is largely thanks to the invention of portable fusion systems. Transportable, easily installable, and largely maintenance-free fusion systems permit explorers and colonists to survive previously deadly environments.

The ability to colonize Arctic-type planets is largely thanks to the invention of portable fusion systems. Transportable, easily installable, and largely maintenance-free fusion systems permit explorers and colonists to survive previously deadly environments.

For obvious reasons this planet type is nicknamed "Shake-and-Bake". Due to their active, volcanic characteristics and excitingly lively plate tectonics, the major hurdle to colonizing lava-type planets is the creation of sufficiently robust and tremor-resistant buildings and public infrastructures. That are, of course, also fireproof.

For obvious reasons this planet type is nicknamed "Shake-and-Bake". Due to their active, volcanic characteristics and excitingly lively plate tectonics, the major hurdle to colonizing lava-type planets is the creation of sufficiently robust and tremor-resistant buildings and public infrastructures. That are, of course, also fireproof.

Barren planets lack atmospheres, often for excellent astronomical or gravitational reasons. By creating controlled plasma domes around large areas of a planet or even entire planetoids, artificial atmospheres can be created and traditional colonization can begin.

Barren planets lack atmospheres, often for excellent astronomical or gravitational reasons. By creating controlled plasma domes around large areas of a planet or even entire planetoids, artificial atmospheres can be created and traditional colonization can begin.

Gas giants are not so much colonized as endured. A great deal of energy is required to counteract the huge gravitational forces, the weather is lethal, and most activities must take place in carefully controlled domes. Were it not for the richness of rare elements, they wouldn't be bothered with at all.

Gas giants are not so much colonized as endured. A great deal of energy is required to counteract the huge gravitational forces, the weather is lethal, and most activities must take place in carefully controlled domes. Were it not for the richness of rare elements, they wouldn't be bothered with at all.

Were it not for the abundance of heavy isotopes of hydrogen in the atmosphere of these planets, no sane beings would come within a few million kilometers of a hydrogen gas giant. Dangerous, loud, unstable, and violent, there is little to recommend them other than the cash flow they can generate.

Were it not for the abundance of heavy isotopes of hydrogen in the atmosphere of these planets, no sane beings would come within a few million kilometers of a hydrogen gas giant. Dangerous, loud, unstable, and violent, there is little to recommend them other than the cash flow they can generate.

As nasty an environment as exists, surviving in a helium gas giant atmosphere requires a large amount of effort. The sole benefit is that leakage of the helium into the atmosphere of the habitats does provide for occasional comic relief.

As nasty an environment as exists, surviving in a helium gas giant atmosphere requires a large amount of effort. The sole benefit is that leakage of the helium into the atmosphere of the habitats does provide for occasional comic relief.
These are another largely unpleasant form of gas giant, as equally hostile and unpleasant to live in as other gas giants. And, worse yet, it is almost a necessity to wear nose plugs…
These are another largely unpleasant form of gas giant, as equally hostile and unpleasant to live in as other gas giants. And, worse yet, it is almost a necessity to wear nose plugs…

Asteroids, often mineral-rich, are settled in a process that is almost indistinguishable from mining. Habitats are drilled into the crust, air pressure and closed water systems are created, and the detritus is processed for metals and silicons.

Asteroids, often mineral-rich, are settled in a process that is almost indistinguishable from mining. Habitats are drilled into the crust, air pressure and closed water systems are created, and the detritus is processed for metals and silicons.
Survey the moon orbiting this planet. With luck, it is possible to find the remains of Endless observation stations and temples.
There are a certain number of basic sciences that must be mastered by any species that can travel between stars. Chief among these is the ability to colonize the most hospitable types of planets.

Though difficult to apply outside a highly complex laboratory context, first steps are made in isolating objects from the effects of quantum and gravitational forces. Development of these installations require enormous resources from both corporations and governmental organization.

Previously thought a practical impossibility, recent advances in shielding technology permit more than two bodies to be involved in a fusion reaction. This opens up the door to enormous leaps in energy generation.

The construction of a high-energy particle accelerator (with energy measured in peta-electron volts) requires highly advanced engineering, science, materials, and energy supplies. Without this type of machine, explorations deeper into sub-quantum mechanics would not be possible.

One problem with coordinating robots and having them efficiently function is their 'brains' and the associated networking. Advances in signal technology and computing algorithms now allow us to have vast numbers of robots that communicate and execute functions in seamless coordination.
This technology permits the extraction of ores from places within planetary cores where gravitational forces would normally destroy both beings and equipment.
While the control of leptons (electrons, neutrinos, etc.) remains difficult, the ability to at least distort and partially 'lens' the path of light provides some interesting potential benefits.
Discovery of this technology allows a high level of control of planetary magnetic fields, as well as the creation of satellite-based magnetic field generation systems.

The science of non-baryonic particles studies phenomena such as neutrinos, electrons, and black holes. Increasing mastery of these forces also improves our comprehension of known EMR and magnetic effects.

The problem with super-hard, super-dense metals and alloys is that they are super-difficult to forge. In fact, much of the work on these materials is not done by traditional machines but by energy fields and particle beams.
With scientific gains in both alien communications and wave and particle theories, breakthroughs are made in basic systems for reading and analyzing brainwaves.

Ages ago, a third branch of science grew to join theory and experiment -- simulation. Simulation became necessary to predict, plan, and model systems that were too large or complex to experiment upon directly. Now, with greater knowledge and computing power, simulations can be both far more complicated and much more accurate.
A better understanding of the quantum nature of particles now gives scientists control over the wave / particle state of matter. Effects on optics and electronics will be far-reaching.
A better understanding of the quantum nature of particles now gives scientists control over the wave / particle state of matter. Effects on optics and electronics will be far-reaching.

One step beyond understanding tectonics is the ability to create and apply it where necessary. While the energies required to do this are enormous, cracking tectonic plates and engineering magma flows has many practical applications.

As the sophistication of etching and printing technologies advances, the creation of a wide range of materials is possible from 'inks' made of almost any element. The process that began with layering silicon to create chips has an increasingly wide range of applications.

Advances in fields and shielding technology as well as advanced materials finally permit the unimaginable -- setting up mining colonies capable of orbiting close to a star, harvesting both rare materials and pure energy.
Based on the idea that inorganic matter can also grow and adapt as organic matter does, first strides are made into creating materials that are self-assembling and undergo evolution.

A curious but not always practical side effect of mastering dark matter is the ability to build objects from it. Certain unusual applications that require stable and inert materials that are unaffected by traditional radiation lend themselves to these unusual compounds.

While the term "infinite variable computing" was most likely slapped across the top of an academic paper in order to get larger amounts of grant money, it is true that modern computing power allows the use of a number of variables so large as to be, for all practical purposes, infinite.

While beings have had 'smart' objects for centuries (clothes, vehicles, furniture, appliances, etc.), recently discovered alloys permit the etching of logical circuits on any surface. Roads, sidewalks, pipes, walls, and floors are capable of being interactive and intelligent.
Using inorganic biology techniques and the native intelligence of Dust, objects of widely varying sizes can be created that self-design and self-improve.

An advancement needed to move beyond the physical constraints of computing systems, it is now practical in the laboratory to build computer 'chips' -- an increasingly inaccurate term -- from subatomic components.

What can be done on a macro scale can also be done on a micro scale. By combining technologies of self-replication (learned from Dust) with persistent materials and the power of quantum devices, living bodies can be replaced as needed with undying, mechanical equivalents.

What can be done on a macro scale can also be done on a micro scale. By combining technologies of self-replication (learned from Dust) with persistent materials and the power of quantum devices, living bodies can be replaced as needed with undying, mechanical equivalents.

Just as an ancient, hand-held shield could be used as an offensive weapon, so modern magnetic and particle shields can be used to disrupt enemy communications and systems by being projected across their vessels.

The scientific method, be it theory -> experimentation or simulation -> analysis, can be imitated by computers augmented with Dust enhancements. With highly advanced computing systems and robotic infrastructures, research can continue constantly across entire solar systems, churning out an endless stream of results.
Extremely advanced mastery of the forces of gravity and time permit properly equipped platforms to harvest materials from the edge of the Event Horizon. Note: Do not try this at home.

While the theory of quantum computing is ancient, the mechanical difficulties of preparing a physical machine with the appropriate number of qubits (roughly 10^7) meant that it was a practical impossibility. Now that civilization has reached the point where its technology is capable of this, a boom in the solution of exceedingly complex problems is taking place.

The time has come for the everyday use of sub-nano devices. Driven by the computing power of quantum processors and advancements in field and power technology, unimaginably tiny objects can be created for everyday needs.

Though traditional forces like inertia and friction act strange at this scale, we are now capable of driving mechanical activity on sub-atomic scale, creating infinite numbers of invisible, active machines.

It is one thing to create cities and buildings that will survive if left alone; it is quite another to create those that will rebuild if damaged. Advanced alloys, self-replicating structures, intelligent materials, and advanced robotics have all combined to create cities that will continue to maintain themselves unless they are reduced, entirely, to subatomic particles. And even then...

While it may or may not be viewed as a boon, intelligent beings are now capable of uploading their consciousnesses into circuitry. Memory, feelings, opinions, attitudes, and emotions can reliably exist in a virtual world, powered and permitted by Dust.

Virtualized and immortal, the final step in perfecting society is creating a 'living' pan-galactic infrastructure. This permits near-instantaneous communication, tourism, and research across all of explored space; much of this is an extension of the basic principles of Dust found by the Endless. Notions of frontiers, societies, and distance become obsolete constructs of a by-gone era.

Whether fortunate or not, every traditional building material eventually decays -- clay brick, steel, concrete, plastic, even graphene. However, science has advanced to the point where the most advanced alloys appear, as far as calculations can tell, to be able to maintain their form and strength until the heat death of the universe. And possibly later.
While the technology does not have the power to cover an entire planet, discoveries in particle physics and shielding permit localized control over the effects of radiation.

A recently invented and highly profitable branch of mathematics, Exploitive Algorithms are lengthy and complex calculations that focus on maximizing the utilization of a given resource. Though they require dozens of variables and advanced computing platforms, the resulting plans and processes are highly profitable roadmaps for development.

Imagine an entire society of technology enthusiasts and early adopters. As new technologies are invented and applied, eager workers seek how to integrate them into their everyday lives. As testing and modding become rapid and ubiquitous, science moves forward at a rapid pace.
The ability to permanently apply grafted or genetically engineered traits into the DNA of succulent plants has great, long-term advantages for simplifying colonization.
The ability to permanently apply grafted or genetically engineered traits into the DNA of succulent plants has great, long-term advantages for simplifying colonization.

A critical pre-requisite to colonizing another planet is to have a firm idea of the science, processes, and skills necessary to do it in a sustainable manner. Recycling, renewable energy sources, pollution control, and careful consumption are among the requirements.

A critical pre-requisite to colonizing another planet is to have a firm idea of the science, processes, and skills necessary to do it in a sustainable manner. Recycling, renewable energy sources, pollution control, and careful consumption are among the requirements.
While great leaps forward in fusion technology are on the horizon, the ability to miniaturize and simplify existing fusion technology also provides practical rewards.
While great leaps forward in fusion technology are on the horizon, the ability to miniaturize and simplify existing fusion technology also provides practical rewards.

By augmenting the natural magnetic characteristics of the hull material and using lighter alloys in construction, this improved ship design gives bonuses to tonnage and improves kinetic and missile defense.

Useful in the analysis of heat and radiation exchange in everything from fire to steam engines to black holes, careful management of the exchange of energy, heat, and work on a nano-scale level opens the door to highly efficient miniaturized engines or condensers.

After decades of experimentation with plates of the right size, material, and distance, the vacuum energy created through the quantum mechanics of the Casimir Effect can finally be exploited as an energy source.

After decades of experimentation with plates of the right size, material, and distance, the vacuum energy created through the quantum mechanics of the Casimir Effect can finally be exploited as an energy source.

Planetary anomalies can be caused by a great number of widely varying problems. As technologies and knowledge of xenobiology improves, a number of palliative mechanisms are developed to allow civilian populations to thrive regardless of local conditions (improved management of habitats and biospheres, cheaper and more reliable energy sources, more pragmatic processes to adapt to alien environments...).

The process of shielding an object from the influence of a gravitational field, once considered purely hypothetical, is now a reality. Steps are being made towards wielding the force of gravity much in the way technology now controls electricity and light.

A first step in purifying and preparing planets for colonization or terraforming consists of reducing toxic elements in the atmosphere and creating tolerable chemical balances. Recent scientific advances mean that these processes can also be applied to gas giants.

The shielding and field technology needed to create the warp 'bubble' around a ship is improved to also stabilize and control gravity locally. Related advances in gravity control technology will be applied to research -- and defense – installations.

Dirt' is much more than it seems. Rich agricultural soils are full of nutrients as well as bacteria, insects, and other diminutive life forms. In order to create a vibrant planet from the sterile dirt of worlds that are over-exposed to radiation, the first step is revitalizing the soils.

Many specialized forms of life and valuable resources exist on planets with arctic or tundra environments. Through the use of low-temperature hydration, a process of cooling a planet's crust and depositing layers of H²O in liquid and solid form, planets can be terraformed into frozen or partially frozen habitats.

Particles can be collided, ejected, projected, split, accelerated, and otherwise abused. A new form of particle control and tracking technology, the mass particle displacement systems allow scientists and engineers to execute all these exceedingly interesting verbs on large bodies of particles and track the billions of resulting reactions.

By lowering the power requirements and toxicity of shields, and increasing their efficiency, it is possible to develop shields on a level that they can be worn by individuals and used to block radiation, noise, and light. The technology can logically be extended to do advanced insulation of any size environment.

By lowering the power requirements and toxicity of shields, and increasing their efficiency, it is possible to develop shields on a level that they can be worn by individuals and used to block radiation, noise, and light. Further development means that these can be mutualized between nearby beings, resulting in gains in efficiency and effectiveness.

Turning the concept of negative mass materials from theory to fact is a huge leap; exceedingly powerful drives and energy sources are now available as technology is developed that affects entropy itself.

Turning the concept of negative mass materials from theory to fact is a huge leap; exceedingly powerful drives and energy sources are now available as technology is developed that affects entropy itself.
Of a density and anti-mass whose values perplexed scientists for centuries, Dark Matter is finally well understood and being exploited for use in shield technology.

The ability to monitor and regulate complex systems -- such as biospheres -- is almost, but not quite, more art than science. This discipline lies at the peak of a pyramid composed of mathematics, psychology, game theory, signal science, regulatory network theory, and system sciences. Lessons learned from the exploitation of Dust are equally critical.

The ability to manage biospheres and industrial infrastructures in environments without light, air, or gravity is almost, but not quite, more art than science. This discipline lies at the peak of a pyramid composed of mathematics, psychology, game theory, signal science, regulatory network theory, and system sciences. Lessons learned from the exploitation of Dust are equally critical.

Turning the concept of negative mass materials from theory to fact is a huge leap; exceedingly powerful drives and energy sources are now available and the construction of exceedingly fast ships is now possible. Driven by Dust-enhanced computational systems, transport takes a huge leap forward.

High-volume condensation, large-scale dehydration synthesis, and planetary temperature regulation are all various parts of a series of complex and expensive processes needed to create a 'wet' planet. The energy cost and the difficulty of doing it to scale make this a very difficult effort.

The theory of a city on the scale of a planet seemed an impossibility. From questions of waste management to psychological stress to food sources, a planetary 'supercity' seemed either an impossible dream or a nightmare. However, with advances in urban planning, psychology, materials science, energy, and the use of activated and partially conscious Dust accretions, these 'supercities' are not merely survivable, but enjoyable and sustainable.

The mastery of non-baryonic matter is a great advance for science which would not be possible without mastery of complex mathematical models and their associated physical systems. Wave and particle effects propagated through dark energy can have ripple effects on a solar system level, effecting all forms of matter therein.
Discovery of alien life forms and analysis of plants that survive in extreme environments come together in a new field that has practical applications for colonization.
Discovery of alien life forms and analysis of plants that survive in extreme environments come together in a new field that has practical applications for colonization.

In a modern universe, the combination of the sacred and profane is commonplace. In developing colonies that are heavily oriented towards development and production, the Pilgrim nation is spreading both its message and its infrastructure.

By building a series of quantum-linked information centers, a faction is capable of maintaining constant, real-time data on -- more or less -- everything. In this unassailable position, no other empire can hope to achieve a greater mastery of technology, information, or Dust.

Techniques learned from a recently discovered minor race permit the development of infrastructures in extremely high gravities. Using this, advanced terraforming systems can be built upon gas giant planets in order to make them (eventually) habitable.
Studies of soil samples from other planets plus advances in understanding of extremophilic bacteria permit scientists to create, under certain conditions, hardier and more productive crops.

First contacts with alien beings cause a rapid development in disparate branches of study - linguistics, anthropology, biology, sociology. These are quickly brought together under the unifying title of "xenology."

Early advances in systems that capture signatures from particles--be they matter or anti-matter--permit simple 'scanners' that poll space-time for any activity--even neutrino, photon and graviton. This information is used to find, identify, and track all objects that will enter or exit a planetary system.

The effect of time dilation and space travel on traditional financial models is non-negligible. This new branch of economics provides a basis for defining investment and profit under non-Newtonian physics in non-Euclidean space-time, e.g. observed interest rates, human capital erosion, and NPV (Net Proto-Heisenberg Value).

Being relatively sedentary and slow-growing, plants are easier to scan and analyze than animals. Systems to tag and scan plant life on a large scale aid immeasurably in efforts to detoxify and colonize new planets an systems.

The complexities of managing a fleet are enormous, and more so when the problems of time, distance, and communication stretch across a galaxy. Systems of Command, Control, and Communications that move at the speed of thought are necessary, and would likely not be possible without a rudimentary understanding of Dust.

A particularity of the Pilgrims, many decisions are taken by a consensus of members. Expanding this human communication to their fleets and comm systems, technology has been developed to improve the sharing and analysis of data.

The value of a good or service has traditionally depended on simple, two-dimensional models involving supply and demand. However, the ability to move through space-time in unusual ways requires re-thinking of traditional market structures and commodity pricing. Without these forms of advanced, 'hard' economic theory, interstellar trade remains a risky game of chance. With them, it remains a slightly less risky game of chance.

In order to further control the environment and resources of a planet, landscaping can be done on a scale that is almost like re-terraforming. This permits far more intensive use of the surface for agriculture, development, or other purposes. In order to monitor and maintain a more delicate ecological balance, however, industry tends to be minimized.

In order to monitor and maintain a more delicate ecological balance, however, industry tends to be minimized.

In order to further control the environment and resources of a planet, landscaping can be done on a scale that is almost like re-terraforming. This permits far more intensive use of the surface for agriculture, development, or other purposes. There is a very real danger of over-exploitation, however, leading to an inevitable decline in food production.

It is not merely alien races, planets, and stars that are strange, it is the metals and minerals themselves that are discovered 'out there.' Xenominerology' is the study of the many forms of metal and mineral that can exist in the universe, their myriad properties and uses, and an understanding of their monetary value.

Thermodynamic systems are essentially simple circuits of absorption, transport, convection, and condensation. To do this on the level of atoms and molecules is something else, however. A capacity to create nano- and pico-scale units that heat and refrigerate is a game-changer. No pun intended.

Optimized logistics are a result of NP-hard solutions to organizational problems. Computational solutions to large-scale distribution networks, when extended into time-relative mathematics (and even with very high time complexity), have a surprising number of applications beyond simple demand management and load prediction.

Optimized logistics are a result of NP-hard solutions to organizational problems. Beyond these simple computational solutions to large-scale distribution networks, however, further development of the algorithms that now result in massively parallel distribution logistics gives productivity an enormous boost.

While the magic of neutrino communications and quantum tunneling did not turn out quite as expected, the exploitation of other aspects of relativity have permitted the creation of lag-less communications across space and time. While the math cannot be explained by less than forty-two Earth years of study, it has been proved that polarity-inverted time-reversed anti-messages are highly effective, with the loss of the occasional punctuation mark.

Extending the principle of hive-style communication to advanced technology, quantum swarm algorithms imitate the shared pheromones and group communications of an insect swarm, but use the quantum properties of newly discovered minerals to propagate this across galactic distances.

The famous saying of the Amoeba: "One being's slavery is another being's public welfare plan" certainly applies here. The knowledge of where the fine lines are between different alien species and their definitions of slavery, exploitation, and hard work are of enormous importance to future galactic entrepreneurs.

The famous saying of the Amoeba: "One being's slavery is another being's public welfare plan" certainly applies here. The knowledge of where the fine lines are between different alien species and their definitions of slavery, exploitation, and hard work are of enormous importance to future galactic entrepreneurs.

A number of different 'levers' exist to control the general level of contentment of a population--wealth, security, individual freedom, self-fulfillment, pharmaceutical intake, etc. With enough knowledge, computing power, and appropriately processed alkaloids, happiness is a state of being that can be imposed from without.

Many things influence the outcome of a negotiation--what the other wants, who influences them, how important it is, etc. Every alien race has different values, beliefs, and assumptions; studying these beforehand provides an enormous advantage.

Biologics — drugs made through a biological process rather than chemical synthesis, a category that includes recombinant proteins, vaccines, and antibodies — are the fastest-growing segment of the pharmaceutical industry

The triggers of consumption are complex things -- from necessities and survival to style and taste. The goal is to find an intimate understanding of how and why every psychological profile in a population chooses to purchase and use every type of good or service.

Biologics — drugs made through a biological process rather than chemical synthesis, a category that includes recombinant proteins, vaccines, and antibodies — are the fastest-growing segment of the pharmaceutical industry

While many scholars agree that "self-fulfillment" is the ultimate goal of an individual, few have gone as far as to determine how to shape and direct a being's definition of that term. In a vocation-oriented society, all functioning members view a long and useful career of value creation for their company as the ultimate in self-fulfillment.

With an undeniably mystic side to their science, Pilgrim researchers develop systems to compare and contrast trends in faith. These trends are then compared to historical data, on-going projects, and observed anomalies. Information provided has been surprisingly useful for forecasting and negotiations.

It has been proven innumerable times that the key to wealth and contentment is education. A highly advanced society, capable of educating all of its members to the degree that they are capable in the way that they desire, reaps enormous benefits. These come in the forms of a highly competent work force, participative government, and improved health and security.

It has been proven innumerable times that the key to wealth and contentment is education. A highly advanced society, capable of educating all of its members to the degree that they are capable in the way that they desire, reaps enormous benefits. These come in the forms of a highly competent work force, participative government, and improved health and security.

Game theory is a complex subject dealing with independent agents, choice, probability, and forecasting. Improved understanding of potential and probable outcomes means that many options and decisions can be considered, even if they were previously considered uncertain or even hazardous.

Game theory is a complex subject dealing with independent agents, choice, probability, and forecasting. Improved understanding of potential and probable outcomes means that many options and decisions can be considered, even if they were previously considered uncertain or even hazardous.

Game theory is already a sufficiently complex subject that deals with independent agents, choice, probability, and forecasting. Certain Sophon geniuses, dabbling in imaginary numbers, multiple dimensions, and time-reversed particles have created an alternative branch of this science. So far the results show stunning success and catastrophic failure in equal measure, but that's the fun of experimentation.

For most of the pre-modern era, high consumption was equated with degradation, waste, and destruction. However, with element-level recycling systems and efficient waste management, the utopia of a constant churn of high-obsolescence products can finally be achieved.

Early industrial societies are more or less vast engines for producing waste; little of what is initially taken from the ground actually ends up as a product and the rest is dumped. By maximizing the processes of extraction, refining, transport, storage, and distribution, enormous gains in efficiency and volume can come with the added value of reduced waste.
